title: How to Play Flash Games on a Blocked School or Work Computer

steps.title: Visit the website that contains the flash game(s) you want to play.
steps.content: Visit the website that contains the flash game(s) you want to play.

steps.title: Right-click the page and select View Page Source (or "View Source," or something along those lines).
steps.content: Right-click the page and select View Page Source (or "View Source," or something along those lines).

steps.title: Press Ctrl+F to open the Find menu.
steps.content: Press Ctrl+F to open the Find menu.
Find the URL. An example could be http://example.com/stuff/the-game.swf. Copy the URL and paste it into your Address bar.

steps.title: Press Enter/Go to load the SWF file in your browser.
steps.content: Press Enter/Go to load the SWF file in your browser.

steps.title: Click File, then click Save As (or Save Page As, or something along those lines).
steps.content: Click File, then click Save As (or Save Page As, or something along those lines).

steps.title: Save it to a portable device, such as a flash drive, iPod, or PSP.
steps.content: Save it to a portable device, such as a flash drive, iPod, or PSP. Wait for a few seconds to let the download finish.

steps.title: Hook up the portable device and open the .swf file in your browser of choice (Internet Explorer, Firefox, or whatever your school computer comes equipped with).
steps.content: Hook up the portable device and open the .swf file in your browser of choice (Internet Explorer, Firefox, or whatever your school computer comes equipped with).

steps.title: Enjoy playing your game, but be sure that you don't play any games in front of your teachers.
steps.content: Enjoy playing your game, but be sure that you don't play any games in front of your teachers.
